intro: Selinum angelicastrum, commonly known as the angelica weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along stream banks. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. Selinum angelicastrum is not considered invasive and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
